chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (A : Set) (T : mEnsemble A) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n : nat), T x -> def_ok_app A T f -> prechain_dom_ok A T (iteres A f x n)

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
prechain_dom_ok : forall A : Set, mEnsemble A -> prechain A -> Prop
def_ok_app : forall A : Set, mEnsemble A -> (Map A -> Map A) -> Prop
Inductive Map (A : Type) : Type := M0 : Map A | M1 : ad -> A -> Map A | M2 : Map A -> Map A -> Map A For Map: Argument scope is [type_scope] For M0: Argument scope is [type_scope] For M1: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _] For M2: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _]
mEnsemble = fun A : Set => Map A -> Prop : Set -> Type Argument scope is [type_scope]
iteres : forall A : Set, (Map A -> Map A) -> Map A -> nat -> prechain A
power_def_ok : forall (A : Set) (T : mEnsemble A) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n : nat), def_ok_app A T f -> T x -> T (power (Map A) f x n)
iteres_def_ok : forall (A : Set) (T : mEnsemble A) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n k : nat), def_ok_app A T f -> T (power (Map A) f x n) -> T (power (Map A) f x (n + k))
iteres_eq_0 : forall (A : Set) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n : nat), prechain_last A (iteres A f x n) = power (Map A) f x n
domok_concat : forall (A : Set) (x : Map A) (T : mEnsemble A) (p : prechain A), T x -> prechain_dom_ok A T p -> prechain_dom_ok A T (concat A p x)
domok_single : forall (A : Set) (x : Map A) (T : mEnsemble A), T x -> prechain_dom_ok A T (single A x)
prechain_dom_ok_ind : forall (A : Set) (P : mEnsemble A -> prechain A -> Prop), (forall (x : Map A) (T : mEnsemble A), T x -> P T (single A x)) -> (forall (x : Map A) (T : mEnsemble A) (p : prechain A), T x -> prechain_dom_ok A T p -> P T p -> P T (concat A p x)) -> forall (m : mEnsemble A) (p : prechain A), prechain_dom_ok A m p -> P m p
iteres_ult_const_4 : forall (A : Set) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n : nat), non_dist_chain A (iteres A f x n) -> exists p : nat, S p <= n /\ power (Map A) f x p = power (Map A) f x (S p)
iteres_eq : forall (A : Set) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n : nat), iteres A f x n = iteres_0 A f x n
chain_concat_s : forall (A : Set) (x y : Map A) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A), T x -> T y -> r x y -> chain A T r (concat A (single A x) y)
chain_single : forall (A : Set) (x : Map A) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A), T x -> chain A T r (single A x)
chain_ind : forall (A : Set) (P : mEnsemble A -> mRelation A -> prechain A -> Prop), (forall (x : Map A) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A), T x -> P T r (single A x)) -> (forall (x y : Map A) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A), T x -> T y -> r x y -> P T r (concat A (single A x) y)) -> (forall (x y : Map A) (z : prechain A) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A), T y -> r x y -> chain A T r (concat A z x) -> P T r (concat A z x) -> P T r (concat A (concat A z x) y)) -> forall (m : mEnsemble A) (m0 : mRelation A) (p : prechain A), chain A m m0 p -> P m m0 p
chain_concat_m : forall (A : Set) (x y : Map A) (z : prechain A) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A), T y -> r x y -> chain A T r (concat A z x) -> chain A T r (concat A (concat A z x) y)
lazy_power_eg_power_0 : forall (A : Set) (egalite : Map A -> Map A -> bool) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n : nat), (forall a b : Map A, egalite a b = true <-> a = b) -> forall z : Map A, (lazy_power_aux A egalite f x n = flag_true A z -> z = power (Map A) f x n /\ z = f z) /\ (lazy_power_aux A egalite f x n = flag_false A z -> z = power (Map A) f x n)
lazy_power_eg_power : forall (A : Set) (egalite : Map A -> Map A -> bool) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n : nat), (forall a b : Map A, egalite a b = true <-> a = b) -> lazy_power A egalite f x n = power (Map A) f x n
Inductive chain (A : Set) : mEnsemble A -> mRelation A -> prechain A -> Prop := chain_single : forall (x : Map A) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A), T x -> chain A T r (single A x) | chain_concat_s : forall (x y : Map A) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A), T x -> T y -> r x y -> chain A T r (concat A (single A x) y) | chain_concat_m : forall (x y : Map A) (z : prechain A) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A), T y -> r x y ->...-> chain A T r (concat A (concat A z x) y) For chain: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _] For chain_single: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _ _] For chain_concat_s: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _ _ _ _ _] For chain_concat_m: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _]
iteres_last : forall (A : Set) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n : nat) (y : prechain A) (z : Map A), iteres A f x n = concat A y z -> z = f (prechain_last A y)
chain_def_ok : forall (A : Set) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A) (p : prechain A), chain A T r p -> prechain_dom_ok A T p
pre_domok_incr_chain : forall (A : Set) (p : prechain A) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A), prechain_dom_ok A T p /\ prechain_incr A r p -> chain A T r p
MapFlag_sum : forall (A : Set) (f : MapFlag A), exists x : Map A, f = flag_true A x \/ f = flag_false A x
chain_incr : forall (A : Set) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A) (p : prechain A), chain A T r p -> prechain_incr A r p
MapCollect_as_Fold : forall (A B : Type) (f : ad -> A -> Map B) (m : Map A), MapCollect A B f m = MapFold A (Map B) (M0 B) (MapMerge B) f m
MapSweep_semantics_1 : forall (A : Type) (f : ad -> A -> bool) (m : Map A) (a : ad) (y : A), MapSweep A f m = Some (a, y) -> f a y = true
dist_chain_ind : forall (A : Set) (P : prechain A -> Prop), (forall x : Map A, P (single A x)) -> (forall x y : Map A, x <> y -> P (concat A (single A x) y)) -> (forall (x y : Map A) (z : prechain A), x <> y -> dist_chain A (concat A z x) -> P (concat A z x) -> P (concat A (concat A z x) y)) -> forall p : prechain A, dist_chain A p -> P p
incr_concat : forall (A : Set) (x : Map A) (r : mRelation A) (p : prechain A), r (prechain_last A p) x -> prechain_incr A r p -> prechain_incr A r (concat A p x)
MapSweep_semantics_2 : forall (A : Type) (f : ad -> A -> bool) (m : Map A) (a : ad) (y : A), MapSweep A f m = Some (a, y) -> MapGet A m a = Some y
non_dist_chain_ind : forall (A : Set) (P : prechain A -> Prop), (forall x : Map A, P (concat A (single A x) x)) -> (forall (x : Map A) (z : prechain A), P (concat A (concat A z x) x)) -> (forall (x y : Map A) (z : prechain A), non_dist_chain A (concat A z x) -> P (concat A z x) -> P (concat A (concat A z x) y)) -> forall p : prechain A, non_dist_chain A p -> P p
prechain_incr_ind : forall (A : Set) (P : mRelation A -> prechain A -> Prop), (forall (x : Map A) (r : mRelation A), P r (single A x)) -> (forall (x : Map A) (r : mRelation A) (p : prechain A), r (prechain_last A p) x -> prechain_incr A r p -> P r p -> P r (concat A p x)) -> forall (m : mRelation A) (p : prechain A), prechain_incr A m p -> P m p
fix_point : forall A : Set, mEnsemble A -> (Map A -> Map A) -> Map A -> Prop
MapFold_orb : forall (A : Type) (f : ad -> A -> bool) (m : Map A), MapFold A bool false orb f m = match MapSweep A f m with | Some _ => true | None => false end
inf_fix_points : forall A : Set, mEnsemble A -> mRelation A -> (Map A -> Map A) -> Map A -> Prop
lower_fix_point : forall A : Set, mEnsemble A -> mRelation A -> (Map A -> Map A) -> Map A -> Prop
MapFold_canon_1 : forall (A B : Type) (m0 : Map B), mapcanon B m0 -> forall op : Map B -> Map B -> Map B, (forall m1 : Map B, mapcanon B m1 -> forall m2 : Map B, mapcanon B m2 -> mapcanon B (op m1 m2)) -> forall f : ad -> A -> Map B, (forall (a : ad) (y : A), mapcanon B (f a y)) -> forall (m : Map A) (pf : ad -> ad), mapcanon B (MapFold1 A (Map B) m0 op f pf m)
MapFold_canon : forall (A B : Type) (m0 : Map B), mapcanon B m0 -> forall op : Map B -> Map B -> Map B, (forall m1 : Map B, mapcanon B m1 -> forall m2 : Map B, mapcanon B m2 -> mapcanon B (op m1 m2)) -> forall f : ad -> A -> Map B, (forall (a : ad) (y : A), mapcanon B (f a y)) -> forall m : Map A, mapcanon B (MapFold A (Map B) m0 op f m)
mLattice : forall A : Set, mRelation A -> mEnsemble A -> Map A -> Map A -> Prop
Inductive dist_chain (A : Set) : prechain A -> Prop := dist_single : forall x : Map A, dist_chain A (single A x) | dist_concat_s : forall x y : Map A, x <> y -> dist_chain A (concat A (single A x) y) | dist_concat_m : forall (x y : Map A) (z : prechain A), x <> y -> dist_chain A (concat A z x) -> dist_chain A (concat A (concat A z x) y) For dist_chain: Argument scopes are [type_scope _] For dist_single: Argument scopes are [type_scope _] For dist_concat_s: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _] For dist_concat_m: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _ _ _]
mini : forall A : Set, mRelation A -> mEnsemble A -> Map A -> Prop
maxi : forall A : Set, mRelation A -> mEnsemble A -> Map A -> Prop
lazy_power : forall A : Set, (Map A -> Map A -> bool) -> (Map A -> Map A) -> Map A -> nat -> Map A
map_sum : forall (A : Set) (m : Map A), m = M0 A \/ (exists (a : ad) (x : A), m = M1 A a x) \/ (exists x y : Map A, m = M2 A x y)
MapDelta : forall A : Type, Map A -> Map A -> Map A

```  
intros A T f x n H1 H2.
apply (prechain_dom_ok_ind A (fun T p => prechain_dom_ok A T (iteres A f x n))).
+ intros y H3.
  apply domok_single.  
+ intros y T' p' H3 H4 H5.
  apply (domok_concat A x T (iteres A f x n)).
  * apply H1.
  * apply H2.
  * apply H3.
  * apply H5.  
+ apply H2; assumption.
```

original: intros A T f x n H1 H2. apply (prechain_dom_ok_ind A (fun T p => prechain_dom_ok A T (iteres A f x n))). + intros y H3. apply domok_single. + intros y T' p' H3 H4 H5. apply (domok_concat A x T (iteres A f x n)). * apply H1. * apply H2. * apply H3. * apply H5. + apply H2; auto.
